action.action-desc: Mr. Owens (for himself, Mr. Hanna, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To improve the H–2A agricultural worker program for use by dairy workers, sheepherders, and goat herders, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
H–2A Improvement Act .

section.header: Nonimmigrant status for dairy workers, sheepherders, and goat herders
section.text: Section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act ( 8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) ) is amended by inserting who is coming temporarily to the United States to perform agricultural labor or services as a dairy worker, sheepherder, or goat herder, or after abandoning.

section.header: Special rules for aliens employed as dairy workers, sheepherders, or goat herders
section.text: Section 218 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1188) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (h) and (i) as subsections (i) and (j), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (g) the following:

subsection.header: Special rules for aliens employed as dairy workers, sheepherders, or goat herders

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, an alien admitted as a nonimmigrant under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) for employment as a dairy worker, sheepherder, or goat herder—

subparagraph.text: may be admitted for an initial period of 3 years; and
subject to paragraph (3)(E), may have such initial period of admission extended for an additional period of up to 3 years.

paragraph.header: Exemption from temporary or seasonal requirement
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a), an employer filing a petition to employ H–2A workers in positions as dairy workers, sheepherders, or goat herders shall not be required to show that such positions are of a seasonal or temporary nature.
